thread.title: EastEnders spoilers: Roxy and Ronnie's funeral is a sorrowful day for Jack Branning
thread.title_full: EastEnders spoilers: Roxy and Ronnie's funeral is a sorrowful day for Jack Branning

author: Claire Murphy
title: EastEnders spoilers: Roxy and Ronnie's funeral is a sorrowful day for Jack Branning
text:
Jack's whole world has fallen apart (Photo: BBC) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Old-fashioned Dot is shocked at the way Jack tries to tell young Ricky and Amy how Ronnie and Roxy died. And he doesn’t appear to have done very well, as the children don’t seem to have understood the devastating news. That leaves Dot even more worried about Jack’s future. 
On Friday, just weeks after his wedding day, Jack will bury his wife and sister-in-law. He asks Phil to speak at the funeral – but surprisingly he refuses. 
An already upset Sharon tells Phil the truth about Denise’s baby, then demands to know why he won’t do his bit for his cousins. How will she react to his response? Interview The family gather for the funeral (Photo: BBC) 
We asked Scott Maslen, who plays Jack, what the future holds for the young widower 
How is Jack? 
He’s devastated. His whole world has fallen apart and he is struggling to hold everything together. Losing Ronnie has ripped his heart out. 
How will he face the funeral? 
Jack is really struggling. He is desperate to protect the children but they are finding it very difficult to come to terms with the fact that Ronnie and Roxy are no longer there. It’s going to be extremely tough for him. 
Is Jack still planning to move away? 
Yes. He is burying his head in the sand and wants to get as far away from it all as possible. 
How is he getting on with Ronnie and Roxy’s mum Glenda? 
At first things were extremely fraught but since then they have been trying to support each other. However, just when Jack thinks he can rely on Glenda she throws a spanner in the works. 
Is Jack pleased that his brother Max is back? 
Yes. I don’t think Jack could have got through these past few weeks without him. Just having Max there to help with the children has made a big difference. At her Whit's end Lee tells Whitney that he has a job interview and that he intends to pay Mick back (Photo: WARNING: Use of this copyright image is subject to the terms of use of BBC Pictures' Digital Picture Service (BBC Pictures) as set out at www.bbcpictures.co.uk. In particular, this image may only be published by a registered User of BBC Pictures for editorial use for the purpose of publicising the relevant BBC programme, personnel or activity during the Publicity Period which ends three review weeks following the date of transmission and provided the BBC and the copyright holder in the caption are credited. For any other purpose whatsoever, including advertising and commercial, prior written approval from the copyright holder will be required.) 
Lee reveals to Whitney that he’s not been getting on with his dad Mick for a while. He also tells her he has a job interview that day and, if it goes well, it could turn their fortunes around. But later, in The Vic, he gets drunk and takes out his anger at his troubles on Whit, blaming her for everything that’s happened. 
It seems that their marriage is broken. Is it beyond repair? EastEnders, BBC1, Monday, Wednesday-Friday To sign up to our amazing soaps newsletter - just fill in this cheeky form to get the freshest soap gossip direct to your inbox. Read More
